title: criticism or helping?
body:
im feeling like people confuse the two so i feel like it needs to be explained. criticism is where you say things negatively to prove that you are better than the other person. helping is where you actually care about the making the person better. 

if someone is having a bad game but trying then perhaps before saying that you fucking suck or the infamous kys. if you know you could have done a better job try explaining what is the problem and how they can get better.

replies.body:
Criticism - You're shit, you suck at this game. etc. etc.
Constructive criticism - You're shit, but here's how not to be shit **Explains Items that need to be purchased for the comp you're into**

However, in any elo below plat, constructive criticism is always taken as being toxic, or is just downright ignored

I've found saying, hey you need XYZ item to deal with XYZ comp gets nothing but flame, so i've just stopped saying anything, no real point in trying to help the helpless

Helping is when you give constructive advice for teammates that will help the team progress. If kids have no balls and take it as toxicity, then unlucky.

Examples: "Try a hexdrinker", or "be sure to react to the inting Sion before he gets close to the tower", or "You'll need a QSS", or "We need baron to close because we have no siege".

None of the above is egotistical, or personal attacks. But kids still take it the wrong way.

thats helping. i get that. im happy to have that. its the "youre so fucking bad." before or after the supposed "help". which usually goes along the lines of "what the fuck kind of itemization is that. kys". that doesnt help the team.
correct. the lower the elo (until you hit plat) the worse it is
